p: Several compounds including a bioactive sesquiterpene, 2β-methoxyclovan-9α-ol (37), two active labdane diterpenes, methyl- ent-3β-hydroxylabd-8(17)-en-15-oate (38) and alepterolic acid (39) were obtained from the methanol extract of the leaves of Piliostigma thonningii, a plant of the subfamily Caesalpinioideae in the legume family with myriad ethnopharmacological uses. Compounds 37 and 39 were antitrypanosomal with IC 50s of 7.89 and 3.42 μM against T. brucei, respectively. Compound 38 displayed a broader antikinetoplastid activity with IC 50 of 3.84 and 7.82 μM in T. brucei and L. donovani, respectively. The authors suggested that hydroxylation of the sesquiterpenes at C-2 position improves the antileishmanial activity, while hydroxylation at C-3 enhances the antitrypanosomal activity of the labdane diterpenes (Afolayan et al., 2018).
